metadata.title: CVE-2016-9911 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Quick Emulator (Qemu) built with the USB EHCI Emulation support isvulnerable to a memory leakage issue. It could occur while processingpacket data in 'ehci_init_transfer'. A guest user/process could use thisissue to leak host memory, resulting in DoS for a host.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-kvm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-common - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-data - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-gui - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-static - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-utils - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2').
